title.rendered: How Often Should Your Home Interior be Painted?

content.rendered:
Compared to a complete remodel, repainting your home’s interior is a less expensive and faster way to give your home a fresh, new feeling. Fortunately, unlike the exterior of your home, you do not have to paint the interior all at the same time. Painting only one room at a time makes the job considerably smaller and easier to manage, especially if you hire painting services in Vaughan to handle it for you.

What Are Some Reasons for Repainting a Room?

If you have holes in the wall from hanging up pictures or from some other unfortunate accident, the process of patching the hole back up involves painting it so that you cannot tell where the repair took place. It is possible to closely match the original colour, in which case only the patch needs to be painted over. However, this may be an opportunity to rethink the colour scheme of the whole room. If you are thinking of repainting the room anyway, this may be the perfect opportunity.

Another reason to repaint the room is that the walls have scuff marks or other indelible blemishes. While they do not affect the structure, these marks are unsightly. In many cases, the only way to take care of them is to cover them up with a fresh coat of paint.

Perhaps there is nothing wrong with the walls themselves, yet you are tired of the colour. Paint colours and finishes both go in and out of fashion. If your room is starting to feel uncomfortably dated, you may want to update it with a fresh coat of paint.

When Should You Paint a Room?

There is no specific schedule by which you should have certain rooms in the house repainted. Ultimately, it is entirely a subjective choice. If you are still happy with the condition and appearance of your walls, you do not “need” to repaint them if you don’t want to. However, if you are someone who likes to keep your home up to date and looking its best, you may want to repaint it on a routine basis. There are several factors that influence how often certain rooms should be repainted.

  1. Traffic: The more people coming and going through a certain room, the more likely it is that the walls will develop scrapes, dings, and scuff marks that should be painted over.
  1. Frequency of Use: The more use the room gets, the more often you may have to paint it. For example, kitchens and bathrooms see a lot of use on a daily basis, so may need to be repainted more often. Living rooms and dining rooms often see less use and do not need as frequent repainting. It should be noted that what the room is used for also makes a difference. If you only use your living room for reading, watching television, or using the computer, it probably won’t need to be repainted very often. However, the kitchen is used for food prep, where spills and splatters may be common. Bathrooms can develop moisture issues that can damage the paint. These are some of the reasons why bathrooms and kitchens may need to be painted more often.
  1. Age of Occupants: If you do not have a separate playroom in your home for your children, their bedrooms serve this purpose as well as sleeping space. Children can sometimes get rowdy while playing, and marks and other damage on the walls of their bedrooms may result. Therefore, children’s bedrooms may need to be repainted more often than adults’ bedrooms, which are used primarily for sleeping.

Ultimately, rooms such as the bathroom, kitchen, children’s bedrooms, and hallways may need to be repainted every two to three years. Living rooms, dining rooms, and adults’ bedrooms may only require repainting every five to seven years.

Painting a room can be a time-consuming and stressful task. Hiring painting services in Vaughan makes it more convenient for you and can get the job done faster.
